thread.title: No motivational speech – Miles just shows W. Kentucky film
thread.title_full: No motivational speech – Miles just shows W. Kentucky film

title: No motivational speech – Miles just shows W. Kentucky film
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest No motivational speech – Miles just shows W. Kentucky film If LSU’s defenders do not already know about Western Kentucky quarterback Brandon Doughty, the truth is in the movies. Post to Facebook No motivational speech – Miles just shows W. Kentucky film If LSU’s defenders do not already know about Western Kentucky quarterback Brandon Doughty, the truth is in the movies.  //on.wwltv.com/1LN9IhW   No motivational speech – Miles just shows W. Kentucky film Glenn Guilbeau / Gannett Louisiana 9:24 p.m. CDT October 21, 2015 Oct 17, 2015; Baton Rouge, LA, USA; LSU Tigers head coach Les Miles and the Tigers celebrate their 35-28 victory agains the Florida Gators at Tiger Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Crystal LoGiudice-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Crystal LoGiudice, Crystal LoGiudice-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BATON ROUGE, La. – If LSU’s defenders do not already know about Western Kentucky quarterback Brandon Doughty, the truth is in the movies. 
“The key piece to that is watch film,” LSU coach Les Miles said Wednesday when asked how he will teach his players about the abilities of Doughty, who is No. 2 in the nation in passing efficiency with a 186.4 rating. The senior has completed 197 of 266 passes for 2,709 yards and 24 touchdowns with four interceptions and is third in the country in passing yards a game with 387. 
“All you’ve got to do is watch it come out of his hand,” Miles said on the Southeastern Conference teleconference on Wednesday. “He’s extremely accurate. He throws it 38 times a game.” 
No. 5 LSU (6-0, 4-0 Southeastern Conference) hosts Western Kentucky (6-1, 4-0 Conference USA) at 6 p.m. Saturday on ESPNU. 
Doughty has five receivers who have caught 24 or more passes. 
“So we recognize that he’s a very talented quarterback, and I don’t think there’s going to be any issues with educating our guys,” Miles said. “All they have to do is look at the film.” 
Miles said Wednesday night after practice that the Tigers’ defense will have to be ready for a quick release from Doughty. 
“It’s five steps, plant and throw,” he said. “That’s one of the reasons it has been difficult to get to him. They have a nice protection scheme. Their front five is talented athletically, and he gets rid of the ball.” 
Doughty has been sacked seven times, but five of those have been in two games. LSU is sixth in the SEC with 17 sacks on the season. The Tigers are 10th in the SEC in pass efficiency defense with 11 touchdowns allowed against six interceptions and 205 yards allowed a game. 
THOUGHTFUL MILES: SEC media relations director Chuck Dunlap just turned 40, and Miles opened his appearance on the weekly SEC teleconference Wednesday morning with a birthday wish that surprised Dunlap, who moderates the teleconference. 
Miles said, “Chuck, do you have a birthday today?” 
After a pause, an obviously taken aback Dunlap said, “Possibly.” And Miles said, “Well, you sound much more mature and wise and capable. Sounds like you’re 40 years old. So, happy birthday.” 
QUOTE OF THE DAY: “It’s always the time that you need to kick the three that is the best time for the fake.” 
---LSU coach and Master of the Fake Les Miles on his radio show Wednesday night. Read or Share this story: http://on.wwltv.com/1LN9IhW TOP VIDEOS
